column2: We are actively seeking System Analysts to join our team in India    If the System Analyst role holds no secrets for you and you are an expert in this field, we want to hear from you! Analyze and take action on ANALYZER_SQL for efficient database optimization.        Take ownership of performance metrics, including monitoring CPU utilization and AWR reports, ensuring optimal system health.        Fine-tune threads and thread counts to enhance overall system performance.        Monitor and manage Open Processes and Mediators, promptly addressing any anomalies.        Proactively monitor memory usage, including swap memory, and recommend corrective actions as needed.        Oversee restarts of App/Web servers and retrieve/analyze logs for comprehensive insights.        Ensure the robustness of database operations, covering performance tuning, backup, recovery, and security.        Lead discussions with customers on Business Process improvements, fostering collaborative enhancements for increased system efficiency. Additional Languages      Knowledge of other Oracle products           Education                Bachelors /master s degree in IT, Computer Science, Computer Engineering (BE/MCA/BCA)

column2: Lead Application Architect will be responsible for defining architecture for Hybrid Cloud applications, involved in evaluation technical frameworks, SaaS solutions.    Will participate in UPS Solution Architecture review process, produce solution architect artifacts (high and low level design, integration design etc.) , and hold architecture reviews.    The Lead Applications Architect influences the development and implementation of UPS Information Services (I.S.) strategy, initiatives, and governing policies. He/She conceives solutions, build consensus, and sells and executes solutions across business areas.    This position assists in defining the direction for projects and solution architecture.    The Applications Architect supports I.S. leadership by planning and championing the execution of broad initiatives aimed at delivering value to internal and external stakeholders.    He/She leverages data, technical, and business knowledge to drive the development of technical frameworks and solutions at portfolio and enterprise levels. This position is involved throughout the project life cycle with emphasis on the initiation, feasibility, and analysis phases.       Position will require hours      overlap with US hours periodically (2-3 times a week , until US noon timeframe) to collaborate with US based enterprise architects and application architects.        Requirements     10-+ Years of experience with Object Oriented Development using .Net with knowledge of all tiers of development    7+ Experience architecting large scale enterprise systems, Hybrid cloud architecture    7+ years of experience with cloud services and cloud ecosystems. Microsoft Azure (AKS, Azure Service Bus, App Services, Azure Functions, Azure AD etc.) and Angular    7+ years of experience in delivering, designing services/solutions for distributed systems, virtualization and/or cloud    Experience in working with operating systems, server client architecture.    Integration architecture experience with solutions such as IBM MQ, REST API, Azure Service Bus    Experience in CI/CD and DevSecOps practices and OWASP    Experience in designing solutions based on Microservices and Event Driven Architecture    Database Architecture experience (e.g., SQL Server), Cosmos DB    Experience tuning and managing Azure services and configurations    Experience with application frameworks like MVC, WCF, PubSub, etc.    Experience with Web Services (SOAP/REST) architecture including API development and deployment.    Prior experience with Supply Chain and Logistics is a plus.    PM tasks/abilities     Coordinate meetings or working sessions    Attend meetings and represent architecture    Draft/document summarized information

column2: sanghvi movers ltd is looking for Quality Control Engineer to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey    As a Quality Control Engineer, you will play a vital role in ensuring that our company's products and services meet the highest quality standards    You will be responsible for developing and implementing quality control procedures, conducting inspections, analyzing data, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve quality issues    Your attention to detail, technical expertise, and commitment to continuous improvement will contribute to the overall success of our organization    Key Responsibilities:Develop and implement quality control processes:Design and implement quality control procedures to ensure compliance with industry standards and customer requirements    Establish inspection criteria, testing methods, and quality assurance plans for various stages of product development and manufacturing    Conduct inspections and testing:Perform routine inspections of raw materials, in-process components, and finished products to verify conformance to specifications    Utilize a variety of inspection tools and equipment to perform measurements, tests, and evaluations    Identify and document non-conformities and work with relevant teams to investigate and resolve issues    Data analysis and reporting:Collect, analyze, and interpret quality data using statistical tools and techniques    Prepare comprehensive reports summarizing inspection results, trends, and areas for improvement    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to communicate quality-related information and provide recommendations for corrective actions    Continuous improvement:Proactively identify opportunities to enhance product quality, manufacturing processes, and quality control procedures    Participate in root cause analysis and contribute to problem-solving initiatives    Support the implementation of corrective and preventive actions to address quality issues and prevent reoccurrence    Compliance and documentation:Ensure adherence to relevant quality standards, regulations, and certifications    Maintain accurate documentation of quality control activities, including inspection records, test reports, and certifications    Training and collaboration:Train and educate personnel on quality excellence    Qualifications and Requirements:Bachelor's degree in engineering or a related field (eg, mechanical, electrical, industrial engineering)    Proven experience in quality control, preferably in a manufacturing or engineering environment    Strong knowledge of quality control principles, methodologies, and tools (eg, statistical process control, Six Sigma, Lean)    Proficiency column1: Business Development Manager / Business Development Assistant Manager
column2: Desired Candidate: FROM FREIGHT FORWARDING INDUSTRY ONLY Job Title: Business Development Manager / Business Development Assistant ManagerWe are seeking a dynamic and results-driven Business Development Manager to join our team at BOXWAGON SHIPPING LINE PRIVATE LIMITED, a leading freight forwarding company. The ideal candidate will be responsible for identifying and pursuing new business opportunities, nurturing client relationships, and driving revenue growth in the logistics and transportation industry.Responsibilities:1. Identify and target potential clients in various industries requiring freight forwarding services, including importers, exporters, manufacturers, distributors, and retailers.2. Develop and implement strategic sales plans to achieve revenue targets and expand the company's customer base.3. Conduct market research and competitive analysis to identify market trends, customer needs, and emerging opportunities for business growth.4. Build and maintain strong relationships with key decision-makers and stakeholders in target industries through networking, cold calling, and client meetings.5. Collaborate with internal teams, including operations, customer service, and finance, to ensure seamless execution of logistics solutions and meet customer requirements.6. Prepare and deliver compelling sales presentations, proposals, and contracts to prospective clients, showcasing the value proposition and competitive advantages of our freight forwarding services.7. Negotiate terms and pricing agreements with clients, shipping lines, carriers, and other partners to optimize profitability and ensure mutual satisfaction.8. Track sales activities, pipeline development, and customer interactions using CRM software, and provide regular reports and updates to management on sales performance metrics.9. Stay informed about industry trends, regulations, and market dynamics affecting the freight forwarding business, and adapt strategies accordingly to maintain competitiveness.10. Represent the company at industry events, trade shows, and networking forums to enhance brand visibility, promote company offerings, and foster business relationships.11. Maintain high ethical standards and compliance with industry regulations, including adherence to international trade laws, customs regulations, and ethical business practices.12. Continuously seek opportunities for professional development and skill enhancement to stay abreast of industry best practices and maintain a competitive edge in the market.Qualifications:1. Bachelor's degree in business administration, logistics, supply chain management, or a related field. MBA preferred.2. Proven track record of success in business development, sales, or account management roles within the freight forwarding or logistics industry.3. Strong industry knowledge and understanding of freight forwarding operations, import/export regulations, transportation modes, and supply chain management principles.4. Excellent sales and negotiation skills, with the ability to build rapport, overcome objections, and close deals with clients and partners.5. Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to articulate complex concepts and solutions to diverse audiences.6. Strategic thinker with analytical skills to conduct market research, identify opportunities, and develop effective sales strategies.7. Results-oriented mindset with a focus on achieving sales targets, driving revenue growth, and delivering exceptional customer service.8. Proficiency in using CRM software, Microsoft Office suite, and other sales tools to manage leads, track sales activities, and generate reports.9. Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to multitask in a fast-paced environment.10. Willingness to travel as needed to meet with clients, attend industry events, and represent the company in various forums.Join our team at BOXWAGON SHIPPING LINE PRIVATE LIMITED and play a key role in driving business growth and success in the dynamic world of freight forwarding and logistics. Apply now to become part of our talented and dedicated team!

column2: Category Strategy Development: Implement the procurement strategy for the Transportation category, aligned with overall business objectives. Analyze market trends, evaluate supplier capabilities, and identify opportunities for cost savings, service improvements, and risk mitigation.      Supplier Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with transportation service providers, carriers, and third-party logistics (3PL) partners. Negotiate contracts, manage vendor performance, and conduct regular business reviews to ensure optimal service levels, cost competitiveness, and compliance with contractual agreements.      Sourcing and Vendor Selection: Lead end-to-end sourcing activities, including conducting RFIs/RFPs, evaluating proposals, and selecting suitable transportation suppliers. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define requirements, evaluate supplier capabilities, and negotiate pricing and service terms to achieve the best value for the organization.      Contract Management: Develop and manage contracts and agreements with transportation suppliers, ensuring favorable terms, clear performance expectations, and adherence to regulatory and compliance requirements. Monitor contract performance, manage renewals and modifications, and address any disputes or issues that arise.      Cost Optimization: Identify opportunities for cost reduction and efficiency improvement in transportation operations. Analyze freight rates, shipping methods, and transportation routes to optimize costs while maintaining service quality. Implement strategies such as consolidation, mode shifting, and optimization of carrier networks.      Risk Management: Identify and mitigate risks associated with transportation operations, such as capacity constraints, service disruptions, and regulatory compliance. Develop contingency plans and alternative sourcing strategies to minimize supply chain disruptions and ensure continuity of operations.      Performance Monitoring and Reporting: Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track transportation service levels, cost savings, supplier performance, and compliance. Generate regular reports and dashboards to provide visibility to stakeholders and drive data-based decision-making.      Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends, new technologies, and best practices in transportation logistics. Lead process improvement initiatives, leverage data analytics, and implement innovative solutions to optimize transportation operations and enhance overall supply chain efficiency.       Qualifications:       Bachelors degree in Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field. Advanced degree or relevant certifications (e.g., CSCP, CPSM) are a plus with 5 -6 years of experience.      Proven experience in procurement, sourcing, and supplier management within the transportation category, preferably in a complex and global environment.      In-depth knowledge of transportation logistics, including modes of transportation (road, air, ocean, rail), customs regulations, and freight forwarding processes.      Strong negotiation skills with a track record of achieving cost savings and favorable contractual terms in transportation procurement.      Experience managing relationships with transportation service providers, carriers, and 3PL partners.      Familiarity with transportation management systems (TMS), freight payment systems, and other relevant technology solutions.      Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with proficiency in data analysis and interpretation.      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels.      Proven leadership skills with the ability

column1: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)/Head of Digital Marketing
column2: Universal Transit is a US based forward-thinking auto transport company, leveraging AI to revolutionize the vehicle shipping industry. We are looking for a visionary Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)/Head of Digital Marketing to lead our marketing efforts and fuel our growth within the competitive US market. Please note: This position is only open to candidates with prior experience in the US market. We are looking for individuals who can fully commit to this role without concurrent freelance or multiple job engagements. Role: Chief Marketing Officer (CMO)/Head of Digital Marketing Location: Remote (Based in India, catering to the US market) Department: Marketing Working Days: Monday  Friday Working Hours: 8 AM EST  5 PM EST (New York, United States) Salary: $1,500 - $3,000 USD per month, depends on experience. Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage a team of Digital Marketing Department. Develop and execute a digital marketing strategy specifically for the US market, utilizing an in-depth understanding of US consumer behavior and digital engagement trends. Manage and adapt communication across different platforms to align with US cultural norms and marketing practices. Oversee all marketing campaigns, including content marketing, SEO, SEM, PPC, social media, email marketing, and affiliate programs. Manage digital marketing efforts to generate leads, convert leads to customers, and retain customers to foster long-term loyalty. Analyze market trends and consumer behavior to position Universal Transit as a leader in the auto transport industry. Craft compelling narratives that resonate with US-based customers and effectively communicate Universal Transit's unique value proposition. Drive brand awareness and online presence through SEO-optimized content creation and strategic social media management. Supervise and mentor the content creation and SEO teams, ensuring content is engaging, on-brand, and drives traffic. Develop and manage email marketing campaigns, as well as nurture relationships with affiliates and partners. Monitor and report on the performance of marketing initiatives, optimizing campaigns to achieve the best ROI. Manage the marketing budget, ensuring all marketing activities are cost-effective and deliver maximum return. Stay current with new technologies and implement marketing automation tools for efficient operations. Requirements: A minimum of 10 years of digital marketing experience, with substantial experience handling projects for US clients or employers. Exceptional command of the English language, with strong communicative abilities to engage effectively with a US audience. Must have a well-equipped home office with a reliable internet connection suitable for frequent video calls, online collaboration, and data security. Strong strategic and analytical skills with the ability to evaluate and pivot marketing strategies based on performance data. Excellent command of digital marketing tools and platforms, with hands-on experience in SEO/SEM, Google Analytics, AdWords, and social media platforms. Leadership experience with the ability to inspire, manage, and mentor a team of marketing professionals. Exceptional communication skills, both written and verbal, and the ability to create content that engages a US audience. A bachelors degree in marketing, business, or a related field; an MBA or relevant postgraduate qualification would be a plus. Marketing certifications are highly desirable. Comfortable working in a remote setting and available during US business hours.
column13: Affiliate Marketing, Marketing Strategy, PPC, Internet Marketing, Digital Campaigns, Marketing Campaigns, Email Marketing, Social Media Marketing, Pay Per Click, SMM, SEM, Search Engine Marketing, SEO

column2: As a Product Manager, you ll start your journey at Freight Tiger with what is best for our customers in the complex logistics ecosystem in India. That can be hard, but we refuse to settle, given we are a customer-obsessed company. We are committed to figuring out what matters to our customers and then doing everything in our power to deliver it.     We are looking for an experienced product manager who is passionate about solving customer problems and who has demonstrated success working backwards from ambiguous customer needs, translating them into disruptive, successful products that delight customers. In this role, you will be defining strategy/product vision through feature definition, prioritization, positioning, naming, go-to-market/adoption and PL. You will put to use best of breed technologies and design thinking to accomplish this at a scale that has never been done before in the logistics industry.    Key responsibilities:    Own the entire product life cycle for products at Freight Tiger from inception, to strategic planning, delivery to live launch, post-launch tracking and ongoing product management, enhancement, and development.    Work closely with internal stakeholders across Product, Engineering, Customer Support and Sales to deeply understand and address product needs.    Work with customers and the leadership team to understand the customer s needs and define solutions in line with the business strategy.    Conceptualize new business initiatives by working with business stakeholders and creating business impact through effective planning, business analysis and operational data metrics, and by driving execution with operations and technology teams.    Create product specification documents and conduct product specification reviews with key stakeholders.    Analyze product metrics regularly and use the learning for product innovations and improvements.    Proactively identify and resolve strategic issues that may impair the team s ability to meet strategic, financial and technical goals.    Define and track metrics that measure the success of your product/features, including adoption and growth.    Freight Commerce Solutions Pvt Ltd. (CIN: U74120MH2014PTC255210) B-201, Polaris Building, Off Marol Maroshi Road, Marol, Andheri (E), Mumbai - 400059      Hold external communications with customers to understand their needs closely.    Preferred qualifications/skills:    B.Tech / B.E. in any stream, and preferably MBA from a Tier-1 institute (but not essential) At least 3+ years of experience, preferably in a B2B startup. Passion for technology and tracking developments in the tech/logistics industry. Self-driven, comfortable with a fast-paced, always-on, highly ambiguous environment. Strong influence and cross-functional collaboration skills; able to craft clarity and drive focus in complex and dynamic contexts. High problem solving and customer-centric mindset.    Strong passion for data-driven decision making i.e. extremely high focus on analytics. You are technically tuned and business savvy to interface with all levels and disciplines    within an organization, from engineers to senior leadership. To be able to communicate both the business and technical rationale behind your product decisions. Product user experience understanding and understanding of mobile is a plus. Strong communication skills, skilled at cross-functional and cross-organizational    communication. Must be able to work independently and enjoy working in a fast-paced start-up

column2: Role: Supply Chain Development  Analyst (JL2)A.P. Moller Maersk Location Mumbai, Bangalore and ChennaiRotational shiftIf Interested, kindly submit your application on the below link:https://maersk.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Maersk_Careers/job/INBLR02---Bangalore---Milesstone-Buildcon/SCD-Analyst_R90080-1High-Level Position Purpose: The Supply Chain Development Analyst is part of Maersks Global Supply Chain Development function within Maersk Sales. The role reports into the leader of the Mumbai office for Supply Chain Development within the Global Service Centre of Maersk. The role contributes to logistics solution sales for Maersk customers, based on identifying and quantifying opportunities and tailoring value propositions for Maersks priority customers.The role will provide a fantastic opportunity to work on cutting edge areas of logistics and supply chain management services across multiple industries. The role is a stepping stone to build a long and successful career in logistics, especially within the global organization of Maersk. In addition to growth opportunities within the team, the mentorship, trainings and on-the-ground learnings will motivate and inspire candidates towards becoming an expert on supply chains. The role will involve working closely with regional teams of Supply Chain Development (SCD) to identify and sell Maersk value propositions to customers. The regional SCD team members (across different regions of the world) will be directly working on specific customer opportunities, working with account managers for the respective customers to identify, qualify and pitch compelling value propositions to new and existing logistics customers. The SCD Analysts will also be following the lead of the Regional Manager in the assigned opportunities to drive high impact customer engagement, thought leadership and in depth understanding of logistics industry and Maersk services. The supply chain development Analyst and regional managers will be involved in creating customized and innovative supply chain solutions for Maersks customers. While the SCD Analyst role will likely remotely engaged with the customer and internal stakeholders, there will be customer facing opportunities for the SCD Analyst role. The role will also contribute to the continued improvement and innovation in the Supply Chain Development team and the larger commercial organization and thereby be recognized globally for in depth knowledge and problem solving on supply chain topics, including proficient execution of analysis and modelling task.Key Responsibilities Support Supply Chain Development team on identifying opportunities with customers and selling compelling Maersk logistics solutions the SCD Analyst will be assigned to specific opportunities where she/he will work with a Maersk multi-functional sales pursuit team Execute analyses and modelling tasks as needed to aid the sales opportunity  Focus on quantifiable value and other implications for customer and Maersk wherever possible Prepare reports of findings, illustrating data graphically and translating complex findings into written text with critical thinking skills  Manage own tasks in the pursuit team to the highest quality within the assigned deadline Strong communication and presentation skills to elicit the implications of the assigned tasks for the customer and Maersk Display ownership of the pursuit, with ability to manage and communicate to stakeholders towards the success of the sales pursuit Possess and continue learning of supply chain industry and Maersks offerings Drive and contribute to innovation, standardization and capability-building areas in the SCD team Display role model behaviour on ownership, motivation and teamworkRequirements Bachelors degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Science or any other similar discipline  Education/Knowledge/Experience in Logistics  Relevant customer facing experience of 2 - 4 years in supply chain consulting is mandatory Experience working with Supply chain analysis software like Llamasoft Supply Chain Guru, Siemens Supply Chain Suite, etc Strong quantitative, research, and data analytics skills contributing towards problem solving Skilful at manipulating, analysing and interpreting large datasets via data science techniques  Working knowledge of MS Office (Word, PowerPoint and Excel) Knowledge of R/Python/MS Power BI is mandatory Persuasive personality and ability to connect with stakeholders  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Detail-orientated and enjoy being an expert on logistics sector  Ability to multi-task and be proactive & independent in a fast-paced, dynamic environment  Fluent in English, oral and written  Maersk is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace, and we embrace different styles of thinking. Maersk is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applicants without regard to race, colour, gender, sex, age, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy or parental leave, veteran status, gender identity, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all legal requirements.We are happy to support your need for any adjustments during the application and hiring process. If you need special assistance or an accommodation to use our website, apply for a position, or to perform a job, please contact us by emailing accommodationrequests@maersk.com.

column2: As an Engineering Manager (EM), while you will be owning one full charter within CX org, you will play the role of a tech-managerial EM, who needs to work with various stakeholders, peers, and your team to contribute to the organizational commitments and growth.About the Team:We at Customer Experience aka CX@Flipkart.com are the people behind the scenes who take care of a customer after he has finished placing an order on Flipkart.com. CX has multiple horizontal and critical teams such as Order management systems (OMS), Incident management systems (IMS), Channels (Voice related platforms), NLP (Bots, GenAI, NLP), Reachout (event-based communications via SMS, email, push notification & WhatsApp)and CX UI (App, mSite & Desktop)We own customer-facing critical end-to-end post-order flow as well as for all CX Enterprise applications.We build intelligent systems that proactively understand a customer\'s issue even before they contact us and we do this at a massive scale.We gauge customer intentions and provide customized and differential solutions. We are both proactive and reactive to tend to customers\' needs.We are the powerhouse behind all the channels that a customer can contact us. This omnichannel approach creates a unified and consistent experience for the customer whether contact is through Voice (inbound-outbound), Bots (Chat, NLP, GenAI, Machine Serve), email, or social media.We provide unified views and decision-making capabilities across Flipkart\'s internal system) to drive a smooth journey for the customer after he has placed an order with Flipkart.You are Responsible For:An Engineering Manager (EM) leads teams of diverse groups of people who are moving toward realizing Flipkarts vision. They are responsible for mentoring and handling high-performing teams where each team member feels the impact of their work. TLs will support people in their career growth. They ensure that the teams have an inspiring vision for the future. The teams work on a spectrum of products and platforms that power Flipkart. TLs will define the right component/system abstractions/capabilities for current/future product/platform asks. They are also responsible for driving execution using agile methodologies by removing impediments along the way with the big picture in mind.Roles & Responsibilities (What youll do):Lead, develop and coach teams of top technical talentManage diverse stakeholders and drive project execution using agile methodologiesBuild scalable and reliable technology solutions at a rapid pace.To succeed in this role you should have the following:B.E/B.Tech or any other similar qualification with experience as a technical leader and people manager for at least 2+ years and a total of 9+ years of experience.Experience in managing 4-6 members team and delivering high-quality projects on timeExperience with building, developing, and coaching teams of the best technical talent in the IndustryExperience with managing diverse teams and delivering high-quality projects on timeSkills Required:Software Design, Software Development Methodologies, Software Development Life Cycle, People Management, CollaborationEducation/Qualification:Minimum B.Tech., B.E. or equivalentDesirable Skills:Project Management, Agile MethodologyYears Of Exp:9 to 13 Years tags:EM

column2: To lead and drive the company s security policies and practices and remain in compliance with government issued mandates and DP World Group Security Management Systems at PFT.       To ensure that security practices at PFT are implemented and maintained for the physical safety of all visitors, employees or customers to DP World facilities and the security of property & assets owned by the company.      To ensure that security awareness becomes a culture within the area of responsibility, using security campaigns, training, outreach, and awareness sessions, either in person to locally based colleagues or remotely through delegated security managers regionally.      To ensure all travellers to the site are apprised of security risk factors and implement measures and mitigation techniques appropriate to the specific location.      To maintain close contact with regional peers within DP World and to build effective relationships with regional and local. agencies who can assist the collection of security information and the response of an incident.      To assist and guide business unit to meet and maintain security compliance initiatives. Undertake Risk Assessments and provide advice on security matters and compliance for new projects.      Support and where assigned, lead security systems projects.      Undertake security reviews and/or audits within the region as per frequency agreed with Regional Head and Group Security.    Drive the process by which the compliance loss prevention standards are attained.      Identify, develop & implement additional loss prevention program.      Effectively partner with operations & support functions in evaluating current & future business process & initiatives.      Serve as a member of a coordinated team of loss prevention managers in relentlessly pursuing improvements to loss prevention program efforts.      Perform interior & exterior loss prevention audits, being alert to & responding to any security of loss prevention issues noted at the site.      Encourage & promote loss prevention within the workforce exercising integrity & ethical methods.      Monitor the site for compliance with security & loss prevention policies.      Establish & use risk assessment process to identify & prioritize risks & mitigation means at the PFT. Liaise & cooperate with law enforcement & industry bodies, as well as vendors, suppliers & partners to effectively resolve exposures & mitigate risks.      Demonstrate knowledge of loss prevention best practices in supply chain, to include application of physical security systems, warehouse security management, investigation techniques/laws of arrest, management of contract guards agencies, delivery carriers loss mitigation techniques.      Conduct new hire orientation & training.    Management of third-party Guard force, ensuring training and daily performance. column2: We are seeking a talented and dynamic Associate - Asset Management at Mumbai for one of the largest Industrial real estate developers with presence across India.       Educational Requirement and Work Experience    Education Requirements: Bachelors Degree preferably with a post graduate Management degree   Work Experience Requirements: Overall 7+ years   Should have worked in large Indian or Multinational corporation, having dynamic and face-paced environment and highest levels of service delivery.    Leverage expertise in financial modelling to evaluate existing investments   Assess and analyze Investment Rate of Return (IRR), Return on Investment (ROI), and Multiple on Invested Capital (MOIC) for the investments in his span of control   Develop and maintain sophisticated financial models for accurate performance forecasting.   Utilize financial metrics to guide strategic decision-making in asset management.   Proactively identify and assess potential problems across various project sites.   Conduct thorough risk assessments to pre-empt challenges in project execution   Collaborate with site teams to anticipate and address potential issues before they escalate.   Develop and implement risk mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions   Provide expertise in assessing the financial viability and market attractiveness of potential lease options and its impact of project returns    The role thus require you to be owner of the asset under your span of control and evaluate the asset from projects, leasing, compliance, and Investment returns perspective.      The role is part of Asset Management team and reports to Principal - Asset Management.   The incumbent is expected to collaborate with the other members of leadership team, to ensure that assets are developed in line with and perform up to underwriting estimates. This encompasses all commercial/business aspects of the project including decisions on master planning, leasing, development and operations.       Essential Accountabilities:        1. Strategy     Develop and deploy company-wide asset management and capital planning strategies, policies, processes, and procedures, in a dynamic and accelerated growth environment   Develop and deliver competitive execution strategies to ensure the growth of business while consistently delivering on project commitments in terms of approved KPIs.   Provide strong leadership to ensure that the company s reputation as a world-class warehousing developer and provider is enhanced in the marketplace.     2. Operations Management     Handle the responsibility for the preparation and presentation of annual budget, annual operating plans, capital and operating expenditure and cost improvements, cash flow analysis, cash management, etc.   Develop and implement short-term, intermediate, and long-term plans to manage the day-to-day operations, improve performance by maximizing revenue and minimizing expenses.   Benchmark property operations against industry standards and market conditions, including net operating income, operating expenses, gross revenue, vacancy, turnover, return on investment and cash flow   Ensure reporting and regular reviews to discuss achievements of targets. Analyze property operations and financial reports to assess property performance and ensure long term viability   Develop and standardize reports, procedures and methods to improve compliance monitoring, complete portfolio analysis and summary reports   Establish a safety culture and quality system for the region with the safety oversight across existing and new assets   Collaborate with the Sales/ Commercial organization that can develop and win new clients and then execute those contracts to maximize profitability and targets   Establish capital needs plans and preventive maintenance plans/contracts for the portfolio   Build, monitor and mentor teams across different locations     3. Growth & Expansion     Support leasing and client engagement team for new business acquisition, design of new product offerings, superior service delivery, etc.   Support leasing and client engagement team for new business acquisition, design of new product offerings, superior service delivery, etc.   Prepare operating budgets and coordinate with other stakeholders, consultants and other third parties. Monitor and manage funds available for possible use in future developments     Key KPIs:        1. Asset and Capital Management    Asset Performance Ratio: A measure of asset performance against the underwriting estimates.\       2. Project Planning and Execution     Project Cost Variance: Comparison of actual project costs against the planned budget.   Project Timeline Adherence: Percentage of project milestones achieved on time.     3. Leasing and Marketing     Lease Occupancy Rate: Percentage of leased space against the total available space.   Lease Renewal Rate: Percentage of leases renewed.   Client Acquisition Rate: Number of new clients acquired over a specified period.     4. Reporting and Analysis     Accuracy of Reporting: Accuracy of financial and operational data reported.   Timeliness of Reporting: Adherence to reporting schedules.   Strategy Development and Execution   Execution Strategy Effectiveness: Measure of the effectiveness of execution strategies in terms of project commitments and approved KPIs.   Policy Compliance Rate: Level of compliance with asset management and capital planning strategies, policies, processes, and procedures.     5. Operations Management     Budget Adherence: Variance between actual spending and budgeted amounts.   Operational Efficiency: Assessment of operations against industry benchmarks such as net operating income, operating expenses, and return on investment.     6. Quality and Safety Management     Safety Compliance Rate: Adherence to established safety standards and protocols.   Quality Compliance Rate: Adherence to quality standards and benchmarks.     7. Team Management and Development     Team Performance Index: Performance of teams across different locations against set targets.   Employee Training Completion Rate: Percentage of mandatory training completed by team members.   Growth and Expansion   Client Retention Rate: Percentage of existing clients retained.   New Client Acquisition Rate: Number of new clients acquired over a specified period.     8. Client Engagement     Client Satisfaction Index: Derived from feedback and surveys from clients.   Service Delivery Rating: Rating of service delivery against industry standards or client expectations.     9. Financial Performance     Return on Investment (ROI): Measurement of financial returns against the invested capital. Review and prepare documentation with accuracy on every detail and aspect, not limited to but including Customs classification, I.T. number, commercial invoices, details, etc.   Transmit information to ABI, verify results and make corrections if necessary, monitoring the release of customs and also any OGA as may apply (USDA, FCC, DOT etc.).   Check Customs release details and ensure any discrepancies are handled properly.   Transmit payment of Customs duties as needed.   Manage exceptions with involved parties and customer.   Ensure that file contains all necessary document copies in proper sequence.   Coordination of entry and break bulk shipments.   Work with Sales on account implementation, ensuring a smooth transition from Sales to Operations.   Answer all customer requests in accordance with our company standards and guidelines.   Monitor closely any shipments moving on an I.T. and provide release, payment and delivery instructions within the allotted free time.   Collect any COD monies owed before arranging delivery to the customer.   Handle and manage all customer contact at file level regarding exceptions.   Ensure highest level of data quality by processing the shipment accurately.   Provide accurate job costing forecast - Ensure all payables, receivables and accruals are set and properly managed per company rules and guidelines.   Work with vendors and overseas offices to dispute any incorrect payables at the earliest opportunity to maintain accurate accounting.   Bill/Invoice each file to the respective customers paying close attention to payment terms for the responsible party.   Assure that Original Bill of Lading requirements are met in a timely manner.   Dispatch freight for delivery, maintaining communication with trucker throughout delivery.   Confirm POD for each shipment and updating our system with POD information.   Update Track and Trace proprietary applications.   Assist Sales, Department Manager and Colleagues in compiling quotes by providing rates, tariffs, etc.   Assure that file contains all necessary documents as set by company standards and filed promptly in appropriate location.   Other duties as requested.        QUALIFICATIONS:      Excellent organizational and time management skills   Excellent written and verbal skills   Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office suite   Detail oriented, able to multitask and meet deadlines   Self-motivated, able to work in a team and independently   Strong knowledge of regulatory compliance with export rules and regulations   Able to perform the essential duties of this position without posing a direct threat to the health or safety of self or others   Able to interact positively and effectively with co-workers, subordinates and supervisors        EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:      Minimum 2 years operational experience   Knowledge of procedures for international and domestic freight, trucking and warehouse services.   TSA compliant.   Dangerous Goods awareness.

Engineers participate and breed the culture of self-drive, which is fuelled with merit based opportunities. In the pursuit of excellence, Flipsters compete against themselves because there is no competitor in the radar. The company environment makes people receptive with open mind and infuse a drive of ownership to succeed and create impact. column2: Provide strong leadership and direction by setting clear objectives and priorities across the Integration Platform function by defining integration platform services, strategies, and roadmaps and communicating to applicable integration audiences.    Constructively partners with functional business leadership and other key stakeholders to shape strategy, identify opportunities, leverage industry trends, develop, deliver and implement value-added solutions that drive financial effectiveness, simplification and/or and improve integration services.    Develop integration best practices and principles, and a culture of service excellence across Technology Services, Data Digital, Supply Chain, and the wider organisation.    Develop, communicate, and provide strong technical guidance and mentorship to embed integration technologies across Brambles platform and product teams.    Advise and provide direction of performance measurement metrics to support the operational objectives of existing and new integration platform services.    Develop and align Data and Analytics Platform(s) roadmaps with Business Platform teams, Enterprise Architecture, and appropriate data and analytics audiences.    Drive and enable a strong partnership across all platform/product support and development teams within, and external to, Technology Services ensuring interfaces are consistent, scalable, and secure.    Maintain and drive vendor/partner relationships at the highest levels through performance metrics and action plans.    Act as the single point of contact and escalation point for incidents which run across integration platforms and own process improvement protocols post-major incidents ensuring process uplift where appropriate leveraging internal / external resources.    Work collaboratively across platform teams and the various platform and product owners to identify the best areas for continuous improvement.    Meet Brambles internal governance, policy and process requirements (e.g., financial planning, procurement, internal audit, people and policies).    Develop an effective organisational structure in place which enables delivery of key initiatives.    Recruit, develop, motivate, develop and retain a technical proficient team. through talent management, succession planning, and skill development.    Develop and execute and effective risk framework for the integration platform.    Successful delivery of initiative milestones on time, within budget, and to agreed success criteria.        Qualifications      Bachelors or degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or related field.    Masters degree preferred or equivalent combination of education/experience.        Experience      12+ years experience managing or influencing technical staff, transformation, and/or significant business as usual change projects.    Proven success in integration design, strategy, and defining integration delivery best practices and linking Business Platforms with the objectives of the Brambles business.    Experience supporting, implementing and delivery on ETL applications.    Migrating to new and off existing ETL landscapes a plus.    Working knowledge implementing industry standards and governance on real, near real time, and scheduled integration protocols (API, SFTP, batch, flat file).    Experience with cradle to grave implementations of API Management tools (e.g. Mulesoft, Amazon API Gateway, Azure API Manager).    Strong experience leading remote, cross-functional, matrixed teams across multiple continents within a multi-partner ecosystem that deliver successful outcomes.    Proven track record of building relationships and thought leadership influencing at senior management/executive-level within large organisations and of building and managing excellent business-wide relationships at all levels of an organisation. column2: This is a role for an experienced Accounts/ Finance executive who has prior experience of 2 to 5 working with a CA or an Audit firm. We are looking for someone interested in taking on exciting new responsibilities with a diligent attitude and open to joining immediately or in less than 30 days in a full time capacity, working 9:30 to 6:30, Mon to Sat, at our SG Palya office near Christ University.       Job Responsibilities:     Key Responsibility Areas (KRAs):      Financial Record Keeping: Maintain detailed and organised records of all financial transactions, ensuring accuracy and compliance with relevant laws and organisational policies.   Accounts Reconciliation: Regularly verify and reconcile all ledgers, bank statements, and other financial data to ensure consistency and clarity.   Audit Assistance: Aid in internal and external audits by providing necessary documents, explanations, and corrections as required.   Accounts Receivables and Payables: Oversee the processing of invoices, ensure timely collection of payments, and handle payables efficiently to maintain cash flow.   Taxation and Compliance: Prepare and submit all required tax documents and ensure timely payments while staying updated with any changes in taxation laws.   Budgeting and Forecasting: Assist in the creation of annual budgets and financial forecasts, closely monitoring variances and reporting significant discrepancies.   Financial Reporting: Generate monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements and reports for both internal and external stakeholders    .    Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):     Account Accuracy: 100% accuracy in monthly financial entries and reconciliations.   Timeliness: Monthly financial closing and reporting completed within the first five days of the succeeding month.   Compliance Rate: 100% on-time submission of tax documents and zero non-compliance issues during audits.   Accounts Receivable Turnover: Average duration to collect receivables should not exceed 30 days.   Vendor Payment Efficiency: 100% of vendor invoices processed and paid within agreed payment terms.   Budget Adherence: Less than 1% deviation from annual budget without valid reasons.   Feedback: Positive feedback from internal teams, especially concerning clarity, accuracy, and collaboration.        Job Role:     Daily Transactions: Record and verify daily financial transactions, ensuring that all entries are accurate and timely.   Team Collaboration: Work closely with the accounting team and other departments to ensure financial operations run smoothly, identifying areas of improvement.   Software Utilisation: Make proficient use of Tally Prime for all accounting-related tasks, keeping data up-to-date and organised.   Financial Analysis: Periodically review the companys financial performance, offering insights and recommendations based on trends and discrepancies.   Stakeholder Communication: Regularly liaise with clients, vendors, and internal teams, addressing any concerns related to billing, payments, or financial data.   Continual Learning: Stay updated with the latest in accounting best practices, tools, and regulations to ensure the company remains compliant and efficient.   Ad Hoc Tasks: Undertake any additional financial tasks or projects as required by the CFO or other senior management.        Pre-Requisites:(Interview Criterion)     2- 5 years of work experience.   2+ years of relevant experience in the Accounts department.   Tally ERP or Tally Prime - minimum 2 years work experience.   Preference to anyone who has worked with a CA firm or Audit firm.   Full time 9:30 to 6:30, Mon to Sat, at SG Palya near Christ University.    ?

column2: We are looking for world-class talent to join our crack team of engineers, product managers and designers. We want people who are passionate about creating software that makes a difference to the world. We like people who are brimming with ideas and who take initiative rather than wait to be told what to do. We prize team-first mentality, personal responsibility and tenacity to solve hard problems and meet deadlines. As part of a small and lean team, you will have a very direct impact on the success of the company.       You will be part of the founding team of engineers in our brand new tech lab in India! Initially tasked with building the foundations and establishing the best engineering culture of the tech lab, you will eventually be leading and managing a team of 5-8 software engineers to design, develop, test and ship software that propels the business forward.     Responsibilities     Manage and develop a team of world-class engineers to keep them motivated, grow their technical expertise and meet their career aspirations.    Spend about half your time on hands-on technical work, including coding.   Manage projects end to end in a fast-paced Agile environment to deliver quality software on time, and follow through post release to ensure effective usage.   Partner with business owners and product managers to help shape product strategy, sharpen product specs and come up with innovative solutions.    Drive continual process improvements in areas like unit test, code review, static analysis, CI, CD.         Requirements     At least 5 years of software development experience, preferably in horizontally scalable services in a cloud environment.   At least 2 years of managing an elite engineering team with multiple release cycles under your belt.   Proven ability to recruit, develop and retain talent.   Steeped in Agile ways. Deep knowledge of software engineering best practices; burning desire to drive the team to adopt them.   Highly adept at project management in a demanding fast-changing environment with tight deadlines and scarce resources. Ability to multi-task is key.   Bachelor s or Master s degree in Computer Science or related field from a top university.         Tech Stack    Backend: Play (Java 8+), Golang, Node.js   Frontend: AngularJS, ReactJS   Mobile: Android, Flutter, React Native   Cache: Hazelcast, Redis   Data storage: MySQL, TiDB, Elasticsearch, Delta Lake   Infrastructure monitoring: Prometheus, Grafana   Orchestrator: Kubernetes   Containerization: Docker, Containerd   Cloud Provider: GCP, AWS   Data pipelines: Apache Kafka, Spark Streaming, Maxwell   Workflow manager: Apache Airflow   Query engines: Apache Spark, Trino

column2: The Brokerage Manager s objectives are to develop operational goals and plans, monitor and communicate operations performance, manage operations to meet customer deadlines, and maintain a close relationship with clients. He/ She is responsible for managing departmental financial performance, organizing and prioritizing workloads, and developing and maintaining standard operation procedures (SOPs). This position manages supervisors within the department.        Job Duties      Manages Brokerage Compliance and Quality Process     Develops operation s quality and SOP goals to communicate to the Brokerage team.   Ensures Customs regulations and requirements are adhered to during the entry filing process.   Manages responses to information requests and notices of action from Customs to ensure timelines are met.   Manages compliance and liability reports to reduce cargo clearance delays and costs associated with non-compliance of Customs regulations.   Evaluates performance against quality goals to develop process improvements and increase quality levels.     Oversees Brokerage Exception Reviews     Monitors various reports to proactively resolve all Customs exceptions to ensure timely Customs release.   Resolves Customs problems in a timely manner to meet customers expectations and avoid penalties.   Monitors Customs memorandums and notices to be aware of Customs regulation changes and industry news.   Conducts error root cause analyses to identify corrective action plans.     Monitors Brokerage Productivity and Reports Management     Monitors operations reports to ensure productivity goals are achieved.   Reviews existing processes to identify inefficiencies and cost reduction opportunities.   Confers with Industrial Engineering and Solutions to develop and implement new operating processes in effort to improve efficiencies and reduce costs.   Reviews daily workload and productivity reports to hold Brokerage Supervisors and team accountable to achieve productivity goals.   Reviews financial reports (e.g., DutySub Ledgers, Disputes, Account Receivables, Duty Refund Accounts, Bill Paid reports, Billing Exceptions, etc.) to identify exceptions and opportunities for enhancements.       Supervises Account Management Process     Monitors teams daily productivity to ensure clients and service expectations are met.   Serves as a liaison between the client, the government, and third party agencies to ensure adherence to regulatory guidelines.   Communicates key performance indicator results to clients to assist in identifying areas of improvement.   Conducts customer meetings and business reviews to assist clients in maintaining a leading business edge.   Maintains clients profiles and standard operating procedures to ensure the brokerage team has client requirements documented.       Manages and Develops Others     Manages resources and people processes (e.g., Quality Performance Review [QPR], Career Development, Training, Staffing, etc.) to ensure the day to day administration of processes and formal procedures.   Identifies individual and team skill gaps and developmental opportunities (e.g., training, special assignments, conferences, projects, etc.) to facilitate individual and team development.   Ensures that direct and indirect reports have documented career goals and detailed plans for achieving these goals to develop them personally and professionally.   Conducts frequent performance evaluations in a consistent, fair, and objective manner to facilitate open communication and encourage continuous performance improvement.   Holds others accountable to established performance levels to achieve individual and group goals.   Resolves individual and group performance issues in accordance with UPS s policies and procedures in a timely manner to motivate and foster teamwork.   Coaches others and provides on-going feedback and support to improve performance.   Identifies opportunities to involve others in new and challenging work assignments and/or rotations that advance the skills and capabilities of individuals and the organization.   Makes recommendations to reward employee performance.        Job Specific Competencies       Budget Management    Tracks expenditures against financial targets; describes impact of area s budget on organizational financial plan. Education    Bachelors Degree or Equivalent - Preferred

column2: The stage/The Gig: Software Engineering Flipkart has defined the eCommerce industry in India and will continue its leadership with its core value of putting customer first. Flipkart is made of people who love being themselves and their independence of thoughts pave way for disruptive innovation on tech, biz and ops fronts. We are looking for engineers who are well rounded - quality conscious, product thinkers, business congnizant and smart not mere coders. Engineers get to significantly amplify their impact with the scale that Flipkart operates at. The same scale also demands the engineers to produce super-efficient solutions. Engineers participate and breed the culture of self-drive which is fuelled with merit based opportunities. In the pursuit of excellence, Flipsters compete against themselves because there is no competitor in the radar. Flipsters area of work includes advanced information-retrieval algorithms, massive scalability,elastic storage, predictive analytics, fraud detection, inventory planning, supply chain, and large- scale applications that enrich the user experience, to name a few. Working with the market leader,engineers mostly solve challenges-never- seen-before. The environment makes receptive people with open mind and a drive of ownership to succeed and create impact. The excitement gets further fuelled with the impact of flipsters work felt and complimented by friends and family in India. The capability to craft object-oriented models and design data structures, implement business logic and data models with suitable class design. Ability to break-down larger/fuzzier problems into smaller ones in the scope of the product Sound soft skills to gel with colleagues from other teams in order to harness the development process. An understanding of the industrys coding standards and an ability to create appropriate technical documentation. You (Must Haves): Extensive and expert programming experience in any one programming language (strong OO skills preferred). Deep experience in at least one general programming language (Java, Ruby, Clojure, Scala, C/C++ and SQL) A solid foundation in computer science, with strong competencies in data structures, algorithms, and software design. Have a penchant for solving complex and interesting problems Worked in startup like environment with high levels of ownership and commitment BTech, MTech, or PhD in Computer Science or related technical discipline (or equivalent). Excellent coding skills should be able to convert design into code fluently Good skills to write unit & integration tests with reasonable coverage of code & interfaces - TDD is a plus Experience in building highly scalable business applications, which involve implementing large complex business flows and dealing with huge amount of data. Experience with multi-threading and concurrency programming 3 years and above exposure in the art of writing codes and solving problems for large scale.

column2: Pre-Selling:  Travels to customer sites for face-to-face meetings to gather information about their businesses and identify opportunities for solutions  Customizes standardized presentation templates with customers information to illustrate benefits of solutions to customers  Performs pre-call analysis (e.g., researches account history, shipping details, complaints, etc.) to prepare for sales calls.  Researches resources (e.g., current customers, periodicals, competitors etc.) to identify sales opportunities and obtain contact information Selling:  Achieve monthly target in Volume and GP from existing and new biz.  To meet the monthly target of KPIs, including GP target, No. of sales and service calls to be done and convert customers each quarter as per target  Sales Lead monitor & management and follow-up with individual / joint calls with superior  Responds to internal sales leads from various sources to identify sales opportunities and create a sales strategy  Assesses previous sales calls to determine action plans for subsequent visits  Researches existing client history to obtain background information and identify and prioritize large sales opportunities  Maintains and monitors records of customer information and account performance to track sales performance to objectives  Presents solutions to customers to gain approval of proposals and move forward with the sales cycle  Submits customer pricing requests to Pricing Analysts to generate new or revised price quotes  Negotiates with internal groups (e.g., Pricing, Revenue Management, etc.) to create proposals and move forward with the sales process  Analyzes price quotes to verify accuracy and determine how to propose the solution to the customer  Setting up SOP to satisfy customer complaints and Collaborates with operations to implement accounts with special needs to adequately handle customers shipping needs  Collections Support to Commercials, including completing all formalities including credit appraisals and approvals on time.  Ensure all rate queries for LSH customers are having all requisite inputs like nature of goods, MSDS, temperature range required, classification under DGR/ Narcotics etc  Ensure the customer is well informed about all the relevant shipment milestones. Post Selling:  Facilitates research of customer complaints (e.g., late deliveries, damages, billing questions, etc.) to determine appropriate resolution personnel, discusses complaints with internal personnel to determine corrective actions and resolutions  Facilitates the drive for debt recovery from Customers in conjunction with F & A  Facilitates proper on-boarding of new customers based on BD guidelines.  AD-hoc tasks will be assigned by Department Head.Regards,Abhishek ShejwalHector & Streak(hr41@hectorandstreak.com)( + 91 - 9167448092 )

column2: The Business Analyst is a pivotal role responsible for analyzing and evaluating various financial aspects of the companys operations to optimize profitability and enhance financial performance. This role involves conducting comprehensive analyses of job cost sheets, gross profit margins, client profitability, labour costs, and more. The specialist will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, operations, and finance, to provide actionable insights and recommendations for strategic decision-making.          Job Role and responsibilities:        As a Business Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and reporting various financial aspects of the companys operations. Your responsibilities will include the following:         Analyze Revenue from Customers and their profitability margins       Preparing MIS and reporting to Business units.        Reviewing monthly/Qtly/Half Yearly and Annual Financials and preparing variance Analysis       Monthly reporting to financial institution.       Working on the limit renewals with the Financial Institution.       Analyze job cost sheets to identify uncertainty   .       To work and analyze the viability of the new projects in pipeline       Working on incentive for the policies in place.       Prepare stock audit documents, renewal documents, and merger-related data for various banks.       Fulfill banking requirements promptly and accurately.       Generate and submit required MIS and specific financial details as requested.       Generate monthly MIS reports and P&L statements.       Prepare Comprehensive Financial Analysis (CMA) documents for banks as needed.         Skills   :         Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.       Knowledge on Financial ratios   .       Excellent attention to detail and data accuracy.       Effective communication and interpersonal skills.       Ability to work collaboratively across departments and with external partners.       Solid understanding of financial concepts, cost analysis, and profitability metrics.       Well versed with Excel and other analytical software (Tableau).        Qualifications:          Master in Finance, Accounting or a related field.        Preferred CA with 1 to 2 years of experiences in related field

Strong understanding of the Cyber Kill Chain, pervasive threats attack methods and remediation.    Knowledge of current cyber threats, trends, attack lifecycle, and various Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTPs).    Detailed understanding of MITRE framework and common attack vectors.    Industry recognized professional certifications such as GCIH, Security+, CEH are preferable.    Good understanding in E-commerce, logistics, supply chain port operations applications will be an added advantage.    Experience in working with Multinational Companies (MNC) is preferable.        Soft Skills      Excellent analytical skills.    Excellent verbal and written communication.    Program and Project management skills.    Time management skills.    Team player and conflict management skills.    Ability to adapt in a complex environment, loves challenges, with the will and drive to learn new things on his/her own.    Cultural awareness.        Technical Skills      Hands-on experience with managing well known on-prem cloud SIEM solutions on public/private clouds like AWS, Azure, etc.    Experience of implementing and managing SOAR platform.    Experience with two or more analysis tools used in a CIRT or similar investigative environment.    Ability to build content in SIEM system.    Ability to analyse and triage IoCs. column2: La Freightlift is looking for Executive - Documentation to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     Policy Development   : Executives often participate in the development of documentation policies within the organization. They may set standards for documentation formats, storage, access permissions, and version control.       Compliance and Regulations   : Executives ensure that all documentation within the organization complies with relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards. They may work closely with legal and compliance teams to ensure that documentation meets these requirements.       Budgeting and Resource Allocation   : Executives allocate resources, including budget and personnel, to support documentation efforts. They may approve funding for documentation software, training programs, and staffing needs.       Documentation Strategy   : Executives develop and oversee the organization's documentation strategy. This includes determining which types of documentation are necessary, how they should be created, updated, and maintained, and how they align with the organization's overall goals and objectives.       Risk Management   : Executives consider documentation as part of the organization's risk management strategy. They ensure that important information is properly documented and accessible to relevant stakeholders to mitigate risks associated with data loss, compliance violations, or other issues.       Communication   : Executives communicate the importance of documentation to employees across the organization. They may emphasize the role of documentation in ensuring transparency, accountability, and efficiency in business operations.       Quality Assurance   : Executives oversee quality assurance processes for documentation to ensure accuracy, consistency, and completeness. They may establish review procedures and standards to maintain the quality of documentation.      No of positions available:   2     Experience:   1 year in Air Way Bill processing, documentation, Tracking.     Qualification:   Graduation

column2: As a Vessel Planner at Kattupalli Port, you will be responsible for coordinating and optimizing vessel operations to ensure efficient and timely port services. Your role will involve working closely with various stakeholders, including shipping lines, terminal operators, and port authorities. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of port operations, vessel scheduling, and cargo handling processes.          Responsibilities:           Vessel Scheduling and Coordination:          Develop and maintain effective vessel schedules, taking into consideration port capacity, berthing availability, and shipping line requirements.         Coordinate with shipping lines, port authorities, and other relevant stakeholders to ensure smooth vessel arrivals, departures, and turnaround times.          Cargo Planning and Vessel Stowage:          Collaborate with terminal operators and shippers to plan and optimize cargo loading and unloading operations.         Take a lead role in vessel stowage planning, ensuring optimal utilization of cargo space and adherence to weight distribution regulations.         Work closely with ship captains, loading masters, and other stakeholders to create efficient stowage plans that prioritize safety and cargo integrity.          Cargo Operations Specialist:          Coordinate Baplie receipt and upload, generate departure Baplie, and manage efficient cargo operations. Respond to customer emails professionally. Prepare Terminal Performance Reports (TPR) and Terminal Departure Reports (TDR). Ensure compliance with documentation standards and collaborate with stakeholders for streamlined processes.          Resource Optimization:          Utilize available resources efficiently, including berths, cranes, and labor, to maximize operational productivity.         Implement strategies to minimize vessel idle time and reduce turnaround times.          Communication and Reporting:          Maintain effective communication with internal teams, shipping lines, and port authorities to provide timely updates on vessel schedules and operational status.         Generate regular reports on vessel performance, productivity, and any operational challenges.          Risk Management:          Identify potential risks and bottlenecks in vessel operations and develop contingency plans to mitigate disruptions.         Work proactively to address issues that may impact the smooth flow of operations.         Technology Utilization:         Utilize relevant software and technology tools to streamline planning and scheduling processes.         Stay updated on industry trends and advancements to enhance operational efficiency.          Compliance and Safety:          Ensure compliance with safety regulations and industry standards in all vessel planning and cargo handling activities.         Collaborate with safety and compliance teams to implement and monitor safety measures.          Qualifications and Skills:          Proven experience in vessel planning, port operations, or related roles.         Strong understanding of maritime regulations, port infrastructure, and cargo handling processes.         Proficiency in using relevant software and technology tools for planning and scheduling.         Ability to work under pressure and make sound decisions in a dynamic environment.         Knowledge of safety protocols and compliance standards in maritime operations.
column13: Shipping line, Port operations, Compliance, cargo operations, Maritime, Scheduling, Risk management, Operations, Cargo handling

column2: Key responsibilities Lead and manage the end-to-end implementation of contract logistics projects, ensuring alignment with client requirements, company objectives, and industry best practices.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, procurement, and IT, to develop project plans, timelines, and resource allocations.    Conduct thorough project assessments to identify potential risks, constraints, and opportunities, and develop mitigation strategies accordingly.  Establish clear project milestones, deliverables, and success criteria, and monitor progress against these benchmarks throughout the project lifecycle.  Serve as the primary point of contact for clients during project implementation, providing regular updates, addressing concerns, and managing expectations effectively.    Coordinate with external vendors, subcontractors, and partners as needed to support project execution and ensure seamless integration of logistics solutions.  Implement robust project management methodologies and tools to track project performance, identify areas for improvement, and drive continuous process enhancements.  Drive post-implementation reviews and evaluations to capture lessons learned, gather feedback, and identify opportunities for future optimization and innovation.    QUALIFICATIONS COMPETENCIES     Bachelors degree in logistics, supply chain management, business administration, or a related field. Masters degree preferred.  Proven experience 5-6 years in project management within the contract logistics industry, with a strong track record of successfully delivering complex projects on time and within budget.    In-depth knowledge of logistics operations, warehousing, transportation, and distribution processes, coupled with a solid understanding of contract management principles and practices.    Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with internal teams, external stakeholders, and clients at all levels.    Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities, with a keen attention to detail and the ability to make data-driven decisions.  Proficiency in project management tools and software (e.g., MS Project, Asana, JIRA) and familiarity with ERP systems and logistics software solutions.  Project management certification (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) is a plus

column2: Conduct remote surveys of assets using various remote techniques, inspecting ship structures, equipment, machinery, and systems to gather relevant data.   Analyze and interpret data acquired during remote surveys to evaluate asset compliance with applicable rules, regulations, standards, and guidelines. Identify potential risks, defects, or non-compliances.   Prepare accurate and detailed reports documenting survey findings. Ensure timely recording, maintenance, and sharing of all relevant information with appropriate stakeholders.   Collaborate with technical experts and colleagues to address technical issues, interpret complex data, and provide guidance on survey methodologies and techniques. Offer technical support and assistance to stakeholders as required.   Keep up-to-date with the latest LR training and qualification requirements, industry developments, emerging technologies, and regulatory changes related to asset surveys.   Engage in continuous professional development activities to enhance knowledge, skills, and expertise in remote surveys and other digital servicesIdentify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and digitalization to optimize survey efficiency and effectiveness.   Proactively seek feedback from stakeholders and utilize it to improve survey processes, methodologies, and reporting standards. Regularly review and update survey practices based on lessons learned and industry advancements to ensure continuous improvement in the quality of surveys.   Communicate effectively with shipowners, managers, regulatory bodies, and other relevant stakeholders to ensure a clear understanding of survey objectives, requirements, and outcomes. Cultivate positive and collaborative relationships with clients and all stakeholders.   Meet established timelines and quality objectives for surveys to maintain operational efficiency.   Plan and execute surveys within agreed-upon timeframes, taking into account asset availability, scheduling constraints, client expectations, and operational efficiencies.         What you bring       A degree or equivalent from a recognized tertiary organization by Lloyds Register in the relevant field of engineering or physical science (minimum of two years program), or qualifications from a marine or nautical institution along with relevant experience as a certificated ships officer.   Adherence to professional codes of conduct and the LR Code of Ethics in IMS01.   Proficiency in utilizing a blend of general and specialized engineering knowledge to apply both existing and emerging technologies.   Capability to employ appropriate theoretical and practical methods for designing, developing, manufacturing, constructing, commissioning, operating, and maintaining engineering products, processes, systems, and services.   Ability to offer technical and commercial management, including project management and process management.   Proficiency in the English language at a level appropriate for the scope of work.   Experience and ability to work with people from different nationalities and cultures.

column2: Job Responsibilities:-1. Communication with OEMs (Original Equipment Manufacturers):a. Establishing and maintaining strong relationships with OEMs to ensure smooth coordination of vehicle shipments.b. Negotiating contracts and agreements with OEMs to secure business partnerships.c. Addressing any concerns or issues raised by OEMs regarding transportation services.d. Collaborating with OEMs to optimize logistics and supply chain operations.2. Operations Management:a. Overseeing the day-to-day operations of the car carrier transportation business.b. Monitoring vehicle loading and unloading processes to ensure efficiency and safety.c. Implementing operational improvements to enhance productivity and reduce costs.d. Managing scheduling and routing to optimize fleet utilization and minimize transit times.3. Team Leadership:a. Providing leadership and guidance to staff members, including dispatchers, drivers, and administrative personnel.b. Setting performance objectives and conducting regular performance evaluations.c. Promoting a positive work culture and fostering teamwork and collaboration among employees.d. Handling personnel issues and resolving conflicts as they arise.4. Financial Management:a. Developing and managing the company's budget, including revenue forecasting and expense control.b. Analyzing financial performance and implementing strategies to improve profitability.c. Monitoring pricing and rate structures to remain competitive in the market.d. Identifying cost-saving opportunities and implementing cost-reduction initiatives.5. Regulatory Compliance:a. Ensuring compliance with all relevant regulations and laws governing the transportation industry.b. Keeping abreast of regulatory changes and implementing necessary adjustments to company policies and procedures.c. Conducting regular audits and inspections to ensure adherence to safety and environmental standards.6. Customer Relationship Management:a. Building and maintaining strong relationships with customers, including dealerships and auto auction houses.b. Addressing customer inquiries and resolving issues in a timely and satisfactory manner.c. Soliciting feedback from customers to identify areas for improvement and enhance customer satisfaction.d. Developing and implementing strategies to attract new customers and expand business opportunities.7. Strategic Planning:a. Developing long-term strategic plans to guide the growth and development of the company.b. Identifying market trends and opportunities for expansion into new markets or services.c. Evaluating potential business partnerships or acquisitions to support strategic objectives.d. Monitoring industry trends and competitor activities to stay ahead of the curve. ?Overall, as a General Manager in a car carrier transportation company, you would be responsible for overseeing all aspects of the business, from operations and finances to customer relations and strategic planning, with a primary focus on ensuring the efficient and effective transportation of vehicles and maintaining strong relationships with OEMs and other stakeholders. Years of experience:- 10 years?+? Contact Details:Nita NalawadeOASISInterested candidates send resume on nitanalawadeoasis@gmail.com
